Articles.Content:
2017

So, as many of you know, PAX 2016 was amazing, with many big YouTubers and Indie game dev on site, and of course, that leads to the question of PAX 2017! Now it may seem a bit early, but I’m sure you know that planning ahead is always good. My personal dream for a while has been to meet the KSP dev team, so I can personally thank them for their hard work, and geek out about my favorite gaming topic, KSP. I’ve met many wonderful and amazing people in my short stint on the forums so far, and have learned a ton about rocketry, orbital mechanics, interplanetary missions, and the like. KSP has helped me understand just exactly how difficult NASA’s job is, and it is my hope to meet them. 

This leads me to my main question: Are the KSP devs planning to attend PAX 2017? I personally think the community or the dev team should host a panel for KSP next year, and it has the potential to be huge, given the size of KSP’s amazing fan base. I have no idea if this was done before, but I think it would be an amazing way to show how far KSP has come, and sell some more people on it. The more people buy the game, the more the KSP dev team can afford to invest in the game to make it better. I personally hope that some of the SQUAD staff might attend, and maybe for a demo, somebody could get up and play a few of the old versions that were major updates like the first ever release, then maybe .90, then 1.0, then whatever the latest version is, talking about the history of KSP and show-casing the features. 

Are YOU planning to attend Pax 2017? Post here! I would love to know, and maybe meet you! Do you know if anyone from the dev team or HarvestR is attending? Post below!
My question is, what's the next convention down here in Florida that they will attend?

It is still too early to give you a definitive answer about our participation, but it is something that we're thinking about. We want to get more involved in industry events and I personally think that PAX is one where KSP would perfectly fit. This year, for example, our business developer attended a couple of gaming events already; including Gamescom in Cologne, Tokio Game Show, and next week, a couple of us, are coming to TwitchCon. So don't be surprised if you end up seeing us in more events.

20 hours ago, ZooNamedGames said:

My question is, what's the next convention down here in Florida that they will attend?

I'm only a couple hour drive from Orlando (hint hint)

1 hour ago, Just Jim said:

I'm only a couple hour drive from Orlando (hint hint)  

Only 1 hour for me  .

Seriously we Floridian KSPers should gather for a lunch or some bring some day!

I'm not a squad staffer, obviously, but if someone can score me one of those impossible to get Orlando Comic Con tickets for next year, I'll gladly wander around wearing my KSP t-shirt and babble about the game to anyone that will listen...

And if I get can some donations I'll even rig up a super computer to play it!

And if I get can some donations I'll even rig up a super computer to play it!

Hmmmm... I believe we'd need a booth for that, and I can't imagine what it takes to get one at a Comic Con. But if something like this were possible, and people wanted to watch, I can throw a stock ship together and get it into orbit in a matter of minutes.... or blow it up in even less time... lmao...

Actually, I've been playing on a middle of the road Mac, and doing pretty well, too. So yeah a laptop will work. My Leviathan on KerbalX is about as big as my laptop can handle.
